comment: Going into my spring semester I thought calc 1 would be my worst class. I was WRONG, Phillip genuinely could not teach and would read off of a script on his slides. Genuinely thought I would fail this course halfway through the semester because his test were awfully hard compared to his lack of teaching. I dont think hes a bad guy just a bad prof.

Never had someone care so little about his students. He sits and yaps about nothing important. He needs to do the school and the students a favor and just quit because obviously teaching is not for him.
Do not take this class if you're not a fan of group work. Most people are fine settling for an A or B, but if you care about your grade, stay away from this professor.
Someone should really get this guy fired lol
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This professor is horrible. His lectures don't go over the topics well, and he just reads off PowerPoint slides. His tests are intense going over very specific concepts that he doesn't cover well. You must come to class for participation points. Group assignments are graded harshly and he changes how he does them by showing them for a bit instead.

If you show you care about this class, you will do great. He always answers my questions well and is quick to provide what you need, but I suggest trying to build a good relationship with this professor. I would take him again if I could. Make sure you study and review the PowerPoints.

lockdown tests every day for the first 30 minutes of class. i missed the first half of class due to a car accident that left people dead, but he still didn't let me take my quiz. told me that it was "just one of the downsides living in this area." ???? like i could've prevented the accident? please do not take him if you have the option to.

he's not a good lecturer. he reads off of slides but is always going "uhh" or "um." it was as if he didn't understand the content himself. lockdown tests at the beginning of every lecture. achieve assignments every week. two group assignments but you don't get to keep your group for the second one. grade was calculated by points.
rating_tags: Group projects--Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Groups are pre-determined and you get a new group middle of the semester. I do not understand how he grades things, but he grades them very harshly. No tests or quizzes. Lots of computer work and research. Something is due every week. He will never let the class leave early, even though your group is done. Nothing is graded for completion.

He is a VERY tough/picky grader. It is so hard to get good grades on the assignments . He's not someone you can easily approach with questions. Attendance is for a grade, lots of powerpoints, weekly homeworks. You have to study A LOT for this class. I mean A LOT! I would not suggest taking him but if you have a good study system you will be okay.
Very difficult and barely covers any of the material that he covers in class. Grades harshly and does not offer opportunities other than pre-labs and labs.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His lectures were very fast-paced and lacked clear breakdowns, just straight content delivery. I felt like I was teaching myself most of the time. The exams were tough, he's a harsh grader, and attendance was required. It was hard to keep up. Don't take him unless you're super self-motivated and strong in bio.

I would advise against taking Vasseur's class. Lectures mainly consist of him reading directly from PowerPoint slides, so most of the learning ends up being self-taught. At times, it feels like he isn't fully confident in the material. The exams are very challenging, and a significant portion of the class ended up withdrawing. Stay Safe

Took him only for lecture. He reads off of PowerPoints during lecture and does not answer questions before or after class. He has 4 in-person unit exams that are extremely challenging and he does little to no preparation. He also assigns multiple group activities that are graded very harshly. Do not take this professor unless you want to fail.
